channel.title: Linux VPS help
channel.description: Alright so my Co-Owner bought a Linux vps. Can somebody give me a code to compile/run the server on there? Please and thanks.

item.title: Linux VPS help
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

You should just read this http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,367407.0.html but if you want to be specific the compiling code is

#!/bin/bash
javac *.java

if that doesn’t work do

chmod +x fileName

This gives the file executable permissions. And the same for run

#!/bin/bash
java -Xmx512m -cp server

But it would appear you have a potential error, Linux has many distributions (the above is for Ubuntu). This may vary based on what distro of Linux you’re using.

en.wikipedia.org

Linux distribution

A Linux distribution (often abbreviated as distro) is an operating system made from a software collection, which is based upon the Linux kernel and, often, a package management system. Linux users usually obtain their operating system by downloading one of the Linux distributions, which are available for a wide variety of systems ranging from embedded devices (for example, OpenWrt) and personal computers (for example, Linux Mint) to powerful supercomputers (for example, Rocks Cluster Distribution...

Read full topic
